DisturbanceList Class Reference

List containing (temporary) disturbances to send to the RouteModule. More...

#include <DisturbanceList.h>

Detailed Description

List containing (temporary) disturbances to send to the RouteModule.

Member Function Documentation

void DisturbanceList::addDelayTime (  uint32  mapID,
uint32  nodeID,
uint32  timeSec,
bool  avoidOtherNodeToo = false
) 
 

Adds a time cost to the node.

Parameters:
mapID The map id of the affected node.
itemID The item id of the affected node.
timeSec The time in seconds to add to the node.
avoidOtherNodeToo If true there will be a disturbance in the other direction too.

void DisturbanceList::addDisturbance (  DisturbanceListElement *  dist  ) 
 

Adds a disturbance to the list.

The DisturbanceListElement will be deleted when the list is deleted.

void DisturbanceList::addPenalty (  uint32  mapID,
uint32  nodeID,
float  penaltyFactor,
bool  avoidOtherNodeToo = false
) 
 

Adds a multiplicative penalty to a node.

The connections from this node will penalized using the supplied factor.

Parameters:
mapID The map id of the affected node.
itemID The item id of the affected node.
penaltyFactor The factor to multiply the old costs with.
avoidOtherNodeToo If true there will be a disturbance in the other direction too.

void DisturbanceList::avoidNode (  uint32  mapID,
uint32  nodeID,
bool  avoidOtherNodeToo = false
) 
 

Adds a disturbance which means that the affected node(s) should be completely avoided when routing.

void DisturbanceList::deleteVectorContents (  DisturbanceVector &  vect  )  [private]
 

Deletes all the disturbances in the vector vect.

int DisturbanceList::getDisturbances (  DisturbanceVector &  distVect,
uint32  mapID
)  const
 

Adds the disturbances for the supplied map to the vector distVect.

The disturbances should not be deleted, they belong to the list.

Parameters:
distVect Vector to add the disturbances to.
mapID Map id or MAX_UINT32 for all maps.

const DisturbanceVector* DisturbanceList::getDisturbances (  uint32  mapID = MAX_UINT32  )  const
 

Returns a pointer to the disturbancevector for the wanted map.

Shouldn't be deleted by the caller, belongs to the list. If mapID = MAX_UINT32 all disturbances will be returned.

Parameters:
mapID The mapID to get disturbance for. If mapID = MAX_UINT32 all disturbances on all maps will be returned.

void DisturbanceList::takeDisturbances (  DisturbanceVector &  vect,
uint32  mapID = MAX_UINT32
) 
 

Takes the disturbances from the vector vect and adds them into the list.

Parameters:
vect Vector to add disturbances from. Will be cleared.
mapID If set, all the disturbances are assumed to be from that mapID. If MAX_UINT32 the mapids of the disturbances will be checked.

Member Data Documentation

DisturbanceVector DisturbanceList::m_allDistVect [private]
 

Vector containing all the disturbances.

The disturbances in this vector will not be deleted since they are also in the other vectors. The opposite would be simpler, though.
